item.title: Kristin add a quote by Anne Tyler
item.description:
"One sad thing about this world is that the acts that take the most out of you are usually the ones that people will never know about.
(from 'Celestial Navigation')" -- Anne Tyler

item.title: Kristin add a quote by Jodi Picoult
item.description: "You don't love someone because they're perfect, you love them in spite of the fact that they're not." -- Jodi Picoult

item.title: Kristin add a quote by Ann Patchett
item.description: "The secret is to keep adding voices, adding ideas, and moving things around as you put together your life. If you’re lucky, putting together your life is a process that will last through every single day you’re alive." -- Ann Patchett

item.title: Kristin add a quote by Bernard M. Baruch
item.description: "Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind." -- Bernard M. Baruch

item.title: Kristin add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Live as if you were to die tomorrow. Learn as if you were to live forever." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Kristin add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The man who does not read has no advantage over the man who cannot read." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Kristin add a quote by Anne Tyler
item.description: "I read so I can live more than one life in more than one place." -- Anne Tyler

item.title: Kristin add a quote by Sigmund Freud
item.description: "Out of your vulnerabilities will come your strength." -- Sigmund Freud

item.title: Kristin add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "Ideas are like rabbits. You get a couple and learn how to handle them, and pretty soon you have a dozen." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Kristin add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "Shallow men believe in luck or in circumstance. Strong men believe in cause and effect." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Kristin add a quote by Theodore Roosevelt
item.description: "No one cares how much you know, until they know how much you care" -- Theodore Roosevelt

item.title: Kristin add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "We are afraid to care too much, for fear that the other person does not care at all." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Kristin add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "Success is not final, failure is not fatal: it is the courage to continue that counts." -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: Kristin add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "Courage is what it takes to stand up and speak; courage is also what it takes to sit down and listen." -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: Kristin add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "The only source of knowledge is experience." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Kristin add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Keep away from people who try to belittle your ambitions. Small people always do that, but the really great make you feel that you, too, can become great." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Kristin add a quote by Maya Angelou
item.description: "When someone shows you who they are believe them; the first time." -- Maya Angelou

item.title: Kristin add a quote by Marilyn Monroe
item.description: "I believe that everything happens for a reason. People change so that you can learn to let go, things go wrong so that you appreciate them when they're right, you believe lies so you eventually learn to trust no one but yourself, and sometimes good things fall apart so better things can fall together." -- Marilyn Monroe

item.title: Kristin add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "Do one thing every day that scares you." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Kristin add a quote by Charles Swindoll
item.description: "The longer I love, the more I realize the impact of attitude on life. Attitude, to me, is more important than facts. It is more important than the past, than education, than money, than circumstances, than failures, than successes, than what other people think or say or do. It is more important than appearance, giftedness or skill. It will make or break a company...a church....a home. The remarkable thing is we have a choice every day regarding the attitude we will embrace for that day. We cannot change our past...we cannot change the fact that people will act in a certain way. We cannot change the inevitable. The only thing we can do is play on the one string we have, and that is our attitude...I am convinced that life is 10% what happens to me and 90% how I react to it. And so it is with you...we are in charge of our attitudes." -- Charles Swindoll

item.title: Kristin add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Always do what is right. It will gratify half of mankind and astound the other." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Kristin add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The right word may be effective, but no word was ever as effective as a rightly timed pause." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Kristin add a quote by Helen Keller
item.description: "When one door of happiness closes, another opens; but often we look so long at the closed door that we do not see the one which has been opened for us." -- Helen Keller

item.title: Kristin add a quote by Helen Keller
item.description: "Alone we can do so little; together we can do so much" -- Helen Keller

item.title: Kristin add a quote by Helen Keller
item.description: "Character cannot be developed in ease and quiet. Only through experience of trial and suffering can the soul be strengthened, vision cleared, ambition inspired, and success achieved." -- Helen Keller

item.title: Kristin add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "No one can make you feel inferior without your consent." -- Eleanor Roosevelt
